messages.content: strengh scaling peak
<poly beam> costs 1 and hits the same number of times :p

embeds.title: Poly Beam
embeds.description:
Uncommon Attack / 1 :e_guardian: / The Guardian / Downfall

Deal 2 damage to a random enemy 4 (5) times.

messages.content: if youre spending upgrades on this you can never spend upgrades on the things that enable it
<Cryo Chamber> + this = funnies

embeds.title: Cryo Chamber
embeds.description:
Shop Relic / The Guardian / Downfall

Gain 1 Stasis slot. Whenever a card enters **Stasis,** **Upgrade** it.
*Things always seem better coming out than they did going in.*

messages.content: still
waiting 3 turns for an extra hit isnt worth it
unless u also have future plans which could let u could scale it up every turn
I said "funnies"
It might not be amazing but I will never think of it as a bad card because of that one run with bottled Refracted Beam + akabeko where I killed Watcher 3 on turn one
I never said this was actually good
It also pairs really well with necronomicon if you manage to get it
yeah
the same way that Necro + Heavy Blade is strong
If you get it early enough and have small enough deck it's a card you can centre your damage aroud
<put copy of card in stasis>

embeds.title: Clone
embeds.description:
Uncommon Skill / 1 :e_guardian: / The Guardian / Downfall

Choose a card.
Place a copy of that card into **Stasis.**
 ( **Accelerate.** )
**Exhaust**.

messages.content: Yea
Let's you get a lot more use out of it and effectively dubles the amount of upgrades you get
Ancient Power or buble burst/twin slam + ruby are also a good pair for that quick burst of strength
Although they come up to a total of 4 energy so it's either energy relic or stasis
its a good strength dump that benefits from the fact that its not garbage like Poly beam
HEY OCEAN
someone is speaking blasphemy
i've tried acutally upgrading refracted beam before; it was underwhelming but at least better then shearing blow
wtf
searing blow is quadratic
refracted beam is linear
although that may be because guardian is a lot stronger then ironclad; so using a bad strategy on guardian feels less bad then doing it on ironclad.

Refracted Beam's equation is D = 3U + 12
Searing Blow's equation is D = 0.5U^2 + 3.5U + 12
you can see how one scales faster than the other
D stands for damage, U stands for upgrades
I don't mean the damage was worse I mean the deck was
You can't compare refracted beam to searing blow at face values

fun facts:
-searing blow has no real roots
-you never see the vertex of searing blow
One is designed to work on its own and the other is just a platform for strength scaling
yeah
once you get refracted beam + 1 you probably don't need more
x5 strength scaling is often enough
ya and shearing blow on its own doesnt work
I've had it work as a damage engine before
~~with necro~~
<<Searing Blow>>

embeds.title: Searing Blow
embeds.description:
Uncommon Attack / 2 :e_red: / The Ironclad / Slay the Spire

Deal 12 (16) (21) (27) (34) (42) (51) (61) (72) (84) damage.
Can be **Upgrade**d any number of times.

messages.content: this is how much damage searing blow does
where U is the number of upgrades the searing blow has

Warped tongs and necronomicon are probably some of the better synergies here. Goes well with inherent strength scaling like vajra, the red key break relic, and girya. Clone to get an extra copy of it, having a thin deck to draw it more often, bottling it to end fights quickly, especially if you have akabeko. In general, this is an awkward card that really needs some kind of support from your relics. Sure, it scales very well with strength, but you have access to poly beam and walker claw that ask far less of you, and if you have a good stasis engine, you can often just play several attacks for free in one turn, which also plays very well with strength scaling. You can also use the crystal shivs, or the floating orbs power to multiply your strength scaling. I just think that guardian has access to much easier, more reliable, and less demanding ways to deal tons of damage, and giving up so many upgrades can really hurt your defense and speed. Having a thin deck can also be pretty punishing against neow, especially if the hermit is helping to add even more curses to your deck.
